data.title: Il Gran Cardinale: Alessandro Farnese, Patron of the Arts
data.meta_description: New Haven, CT: Yale University Press, 1992. Hardbound. Black cloth with glossy color dustjacket. x, 323 pp., many color and bw plates. VG/VG a very nice copy. Item #117375 From dustjacket: Cardinal Alessandro Farnese, the wealthy and powerful grandson of Pope Paul III, was the most important individual patron of the visual arts in sixteenth-century Rome. Using a wealth of hitherto unpublished material, Clare Robertson
data.text:
Robertson, Clare

New Haven, CT: Yale University Press, 1992. Hardbound. Black cloth with glossy color dustjacket. x, 323 pp., many color and bw plates. VG/VG a very nice copy. Item #117375

From dustjacket:"Cardinal Alessandro Farnese, the wealthy and powerful grandson of Pope Paul III, was the most important individual patron of the visual arts in sixteenth-century Rome. Using a wealth of hitherto unpublished material, Clare Robertson provides the first thorough reconstruction of Farnese"s development and influence as a patron, at the same time raising important questions about the attitudes and motives of Renaissance patrons and challenging a number of current art-historical assumptions about patronage..."
